programme.desc: An ambitious friend group navigates life and love in LA.(n)

programme.title: JURASSIC PARK
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's masterpiece follows a team of scientists on an island to witness real dinosaurs in a park, only to see everything go wrong when a storm hits.(n)

programme.title: FOUR CHRISTMASES
programme.desc: When their exotic vacation flight is cancelled, a couple has no choice but to spend Christmas with each of their divorced parents and dysfunctional families.(n)

programme.title: UP IN THE AIR
programme.desc: George Clooney is Ryan Bingham, a corporate downsizing expert whose cherished life on the road is threatened.(n)

programme.title: THE LOST WORLD: JURASSIC PARK
programme.desc: Four years after Jurassic Park, mathematician Ian Malcolm has to venture into a second island to save his girlfriend from becoming dinosaur bait.(n)

programme.title: LEGO JURASSIC PARK: THE UNOFFICIAL RETELLING
programme.desc: The ever charming and now slightly older Chaos Mathematician Dr. Ian Malcolm retells the tale of what happened that dreadful night at Jurassic Park.(n)

programme.title: SKYSCRAPER
programme.desc: When a skyscraper is suddenly ablaze, a war veteran who is on assignment to assess the security of the building finds himself framed for it.(n)

programme.title: AQUAMAN
programme.desc: A half-human, half-Atlantean man goes on a journey to see if he has what it takes to be the rightful king of Atlantis.(n)

programme.title: KUNG FU PANDA
programme.desc: Jack Black is Po, the unlikely hero chosen to fulfill an ancient kung fu prophecy in this delightful animation voiced by a star-studded cast.(n)

programme.title: AMERICAN MADE
programme.desc: Tom Cruise stars in an international escapade based on the outrageous, true exploits of hustler and pilot recruited to run one of the biggest covert operations in the U.S.(n)

programme.title: HARRY POTTER AND THE ORDER OF THE PHOENIX
programme.desc: When a new professor's methods leave Hogwarts unprepared to fight the rising tide of evil, Harry teaches students how to defend against the dark arts.(n)

programme.title: A MINECRAFT MOVIE
programme.desc: Four misfits struggling with ordinary problems are pulled through a portal into the Overworld.(n)

programme.title: MISSION: IMPOSSIBLE – THE FINAL RECKONING
programme.desc: Our lives are the sum of our choices. Tom Cruise is Ethan Hunt in Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning.(n)

programme.desc: Mickey Barnes is working for an employer who demands to die for a living.(n)

programme.desc: The Center for the Study of Extra-Terrestrial Intelligence defines a "Close Encounter of The Fifth Kind" as direct human contact and communication with extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens (S16)
programme.desc: Deep beneath the sands of Egypt lie 24 enormous sarcophagi—and every one of them is empty. What purpose might these giant tombs have served? And is it possible that they were designed by alien visitors?

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island (S11)
programme.desc: As the team makes contact with the elusive tunnel under the Garden Shaft, an exciting new scientific theory surfaces which suggests a connection between Nolan's Cross and the Knights Templar.

programme.title: History's Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman (S2)
programme.desc: A lifelong escape artist, Forrest Tucker, ends up in San Quentin prison. But despite his advanced age, he manages to engineer one of the most audacious prison breaks of all time.

programme.title: Hazardous History With Henry Winkler (S1)
programme.desc: The modern concept of 'extreme sports' is a product of marketing, but back in the old days, the rules of our nation's sports made them truly extreme. From bone-crushing football to deadly baseball games.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner (S3)
programme.desc: Today, human civilisation spans the globe, and there are more than 7 billion people on Earth. But how did humanity evolve? Were there other kinds of human-like creatures?

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner (S3)
programme.desc: Humans can survive catastrophic injuries and deadly scenarios that defy the odds in ways that are inexplicable. Is cheating death when survival is seemingly impossible simply fate or good fortune?

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner (S3)
programme.desc: The Founding Fathers established the pillars of freedom and democracy. New information has emerged about the secrets of these important historical figures. What truths have remained in the shadows?

programme.title: Mysteries Unearthed With Danny Trejo (S1)
programme.desc: From priceless treasure found inside a lost city to an ancient manuscript hidden behind a wall, we explore secrets lost deep inside various unseen chambers, like tunnels, caves, or even burial sites.

programme.title: The UnBelievable With Dan Aykroyd (S2)
programme.desc: We've heard the tales of great wars fought with groundbreaking weaponry, but what about everything else in between? Like missiles manned by pigeons to a helmet outfitted with firearms.

programme.title: The UnBelievable With Dan Aykroyd (S2)
programme.desc: Some of the world's most valiant figures overcome the most treacherous and downright bizarre circumstances. Like a man who survives the apocalypse, or a woman involved in three maritime disasters.

programme.title: The Mega-Brands That Built The World (S2)
programme.desc: A game designer named Steve Jobs starts a personal computer company in his parents' garage on his way to bringing computers mainstream.

programme.title: The Pickers (S18)
programme.desc: A jaw-dropping Arizona property features antique motorbikes as far as the eye can see, and in Tennessee, an ultra-rare Zephyr gets a tire-blowing test drive.

programme.title: The Secret Life of Trees (S1)
programme.desc: Even the mightiest oak must start life as a tiny acorn. We explore the secret lives of young trees, discovering how they magically transform from minute seeds into mature adults. programme.desc: Joanna's journey begins in the sub-zero temperatures of Hokkaido - Japan's wild north. Known for its rugged terrain, it is home to some of Japan's most endangered wild animals.

programme.title: Running Wild with Bear Grylls (S2)
programme.desc: Actress Michelle Rodriguez and Bear Grylls head to the Nevada. Unexpected high winds during a sky-diving trip send Michelle off course; finally the duo must come up with clever ways to stay hydrated.

programme.title: The Secret Life of Trees (S1)
programme.desc: Even the mightiest oak must start life as a tiny acorn. We explore the secret lives of young trees, discovering how they magically transform from minute seeds into mature adults. But with fewer than one in a thousand seeds reaching adulthood, a tree's early years are the most treacherous of its life.

programme.title: Kingdom (S1)
programme.desc: Four rival families - leopards, hyena, wild dogs and lions - all try to claim a rich corner of Zambian paradise as their home. Who will succeed in ruling this precious kingdom?(n)

programme.title: Kingdom (S1)
programme.desc: Leopard Mutima's relationship with her mother is at breaking point, and as the balance of power in Nsefu tips towards the lions, the hyenas and wild dogs fight to raise their young.(n)

programme.title: Kingdom (S1)
programme.desc: Leopard Olimba finds a mate, but fortunes turn against the lions. Extreme flooding leads to disaster for the hyena clan, and the time has come for leopard Mutima to leave.(n)

programme.title: Kingdom (S1)
programme.desc: Injured wild dog Flint helps care for Storm's largest ever litter of pups. Leopard Mutima searches for a home, and the lions are challenged by forces beyond their control.(n)

programme.title: Kingdom (S1)
programme.desc: The final chapter. Olimba struggles with old age, and the wild dog story takes an unexpected turn. The lions and the hyenas both enjoy a baby boom - but who has the power to rule?(n)

programme.title: Kingdom (S1)

programme.title: Secrets of the Jurassic Dinosaurs (S1)
programme.desc: An international team of palaeontologists in the remote badlands of Wyoming investigate a mysterious dinosaur graveyard. Packed with over a dozen skeletons including predators such as the fearsome Allosaurus and iconic giants like Diplodocus, as well as fossilised plants and footprints.(n)

programme.title: Incredible Journeys with Simon Reeve (S1)

programme.title: Saving Venice
programme.desc: Venice is under attack from climate change. Flooding is becoming more frequent. With each inundation of seawater, more salt impregnates the city's historic buildings. As it crystallises, it rips the bricks, mortar and stone to shreds. The city is crumbling. Venice's very existence is hanging in the balance. Can scientists and engineers find ways to protect this unique jewel of architecture, beauty and culture before it's too late?(n)

programme.title: Japanology Plus
programme.desc: Admired by John F. Kennedy, Uesugi Yozan was a feudal lord who took over the Yonezawa Domain at the age of 15. He enacted financial reforms that led the destitute domain to a miraculous recovery.

programme.title: NHK WORLD-JAPAN Special program
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a wide range of programs from news, current affairs, documentaries, etc. focusing on Japan and Asia.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: History Uncovered
programme.desc: Time and Tide transcends time to detail extraordinary historical events in Japan and the world. Join NHK WORLD-JAPAN on a journey that reveals the truth behind some of the turning points of the past.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode looks at words related to a play and acting. Explore the unique culture behind them.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: At the Niihama Taiko Matsuri, teams of around 150 people carry taikodai: three-tonne parade floats housing a huge taiko drum. They compete to give the most powerful synchronized performance.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: DESIGN X STORIES
programme.desc: Crafts, fashion, products, buildings, and food: explore a diverse range of Japanese designs and the ideas and values of their creators. Our presenters visit designers at work to reveal new stories.

programme.title: Let's Enjoy MATH with Barky the Dog
programme.desc: Numbler erases a part of a cake delivery memo, resulting in the delivery of four cakes instead of one. Barky solves the mystery by showing the difference between ordinal numbers and cardinal numbers.

programme.title: TAKE TECH
programme.desc: A program for upper primary to lower secondary school children to explore the everyday technologies all around them. Each episode takes a piece of familiar tech to find out what it does and how.

programme.title: Little Charo
programme.desc: Little Charo is an animation series about a Japanese dog who got lost in NY. "I want to see my owner again!" Charo starts his adventure back home. Season 2-16.

programme.title: Japanology Plus mini
programme.desc: Japanology Plus explores Japanese life and culture. In this 5-minute digest, we look at kotatsu: traditional heated tables.

programme.title: A Cat's-Eye View of Japan
programme.desc: A local cat guides us to a fairy tale palace-or rather, a shrine that looks like the palace! Together with Iwago, we visit scenic spots, including a tea farm that's patrolled by an early-rising cat.

programme.title: ANIME MANGA EXPLOSION

programme.title: The New Adventures of Rockie and Her Friends
programme.desc: Puppet action show for children. In a distant post-human future where surviving creatures have formed a community, new-breed dinosaur girl Rockie sets out on hilarious adventures with her schoolmates.

programme.desc: This show for kids promotes a greater understanding for people with difficulties and helps develop empathy. With the help of two fairies, the main character thinks about what can be done to help.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Chatroom Japan
programme.desc: A Ghanaian entrepreneur and resident of Japan launched an online radio station as a way of giving back to the community. The project is inspiring some young Africans to pursue their own dreams.

programme.title: IMPACTS: Climates Change the World
programme.desc: Dengue fever cases worldwide have risen to 30 times their levels 20 years ago, with global warming connected to infection spread by mosquitoes, especially in countries such as the Philippines.

programme.title: DESIGN MUSEUM JAPAN
programme.desc: Miyanaga Aiko (Contemporary artist) visits Kyoto. The Mincho font, drawn by hand in around 1990, evokes 350-year-old hand-carved woodblocks, made to print Buddhist sutras.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.desc: We meet Austrian fashion designer Edwina Horl Ota who works to bring her late husband's Tokyo ramen shop back to its former glory, and Chinese Masuda Sei who cleans up bullet trains at Tokyo Station.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Time-lapse Japan
programme.desc: The Jomon period dates roughly from 13,000 to 300 BC. We examine various aspects of Jomon society, with footage from time-lapse creator Shimizu Daisuke. This time: the Sannai Maruyama Site.

programme.title: BOSAI:Science that Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: Japan's snow is a big draw for tourists, but snow and ice can also pose dangers to drivers. We'll look at some Japanese technology being developed to prevent whiteouts and accidents on slippery roads.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to hot water. Explore the unique culture behind them.
